intro: Urtica procera, commonly known as the stinging nettle, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its hollow,螫刺 (stinging) hairs that release irritants upon contact with the skin. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges and produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters. Urtica procera thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. It is a member of the Urticaceae family and has been used historically for its medicinal and nutritional properties.
